name: ocarina
definition: A small terra-cotta or plastic wind instrument with finger holes, a mouthpiece, and an elongated ovoid shape.
description:
The ocarina is an ancient wind musical instrument, a type of vessel flute. It belongs to a very old family of instruments, believed to date back over 12,000 years.

Variations exist, but a typical ocarina is an enclosed space with four to twelve finger holes and a mouthpiece that projects from the body.

Because the ocarina is in a round or box-like shape, its sound is a little different from other flutes.

It is traditionally made from clay or ceramic, but other materials are also used such as plastic, wood, glass, metal or bone.

Modern ocarina was invented in 1853 by 17-year-old Giuseppe Donati, who also gave it the name ocarina. In Italian ocarina means 'little goose'.

Initially regarded as a toy instrument, it won professional popularity in the 1930s when 'sweet potatoes' ocarinas, of different sizes, were played in harmony in American popular music.

facts.name: Instruments resembling ocarina are much older
facts.value: While modern ocarina was created on the middle of XIX-th century, instruments like the ocarina had been made for hundreds of years before that in South America, China, and Africa.

facts.name: Japan makes ocarinas from 1928
facts.value: In 1928, the Japanese began making ocarinas. They added two small holes to the old kind of ocarinas. Japanese 12-hole ocarinas can play a larger scale than 10-hole ocarinas.

facts.name: Sweet potato
facts.value: In the United States the ocarina was called the sweet potato, because its shape is like that.

facts.name: Despite differences all ocarinas emit similar sounds
facts.value: The ocarina is an unusual wind instrument that comes in a variety of shapes and sizes. Despite how different they look, all ocarinas emit fairly similar sounds.

facts.name: Resonator can create overtones
facts.value: The resonator in the ocarina can create overtones, but because of the common 'egg' shape, these overtones are many octaves above the keynote scale.

facts.name: Many different styles of ocarinas
facts.value: There are many different styles of ocarinas varying in shape and the number of holes: transverse, pendants, inline, or multi-chambered.

facts.name: English ocarina was invested in 1960s
facts.value: In the 1960s, the English ocarina was invented. It has four finger holes, and may have one or two thumb holes. English ocarinas are made in many shapes.

facts.name: The tone depends on area of opened holes
facts.value: Unlike many flutes, ocarinas do not rely on pipe length to produce a particular tone. Instead the tone is dependent on the ratio of the total surface area of opened holes to the total cubic volume enclosed by the instrument.

facts.name: Holes placement is largely irrelevant
facts.value: Ocarina sound is created by resonance of the entire cavity and the placement of the holes is largely irrelevant – their size is the most important factor.
